column4: I'm having issues with my USB drive, it has three partitions all formatted as HSF+, `mount` gives me, /dev/sde12 on /media/Akeru type hfsplus (rw,nosuid,nodev,uid=1000,gid=1000) but when I try to make changes (i.e. create a directory) and it says: mkdir: cannot create directory `sekhmet': Read-only file system
have you tried remounting it read/write?
from the mount output, it looks like it *is* read/write, if not, how do I do that?
it looks like, *maybe* mount -o remount rw /media/Akeru would do it?
I understand but I meant doing it manually, first try umounting it with umount /dev/sde12 the manually remount it with....yeah thats it :)
what was the filesystem again HFS?
gonna reboot, see if it brings up the drive in r/w
I'm just hoping it comes back up, I'm trying to backup my RAID which has issues :/
yikes have you thought about copying to the hfs drive over the network?
is it an external or internal drive?
